items.title: [BREAKING] Parameterized #define macros result in broken VSTi which refuses to scan/initialize
items.body:
If I have multiple UI components that share graphics, like a row of knobs, I will handle the placement using macros. This way any tweaking is done by simply adjusting a few parameters and the whole UI realigns itself. 

Here's one such macro:

`#define UI_PREF_KNOB_L_X(numberFromCenter) (UI.WIDTH/2) - UI.PREFERENCES_CENTER_OFFSET - UI.PREFERENCES_KNOB_DISTANCE * numberFromCenter - UI.PREFERENCES_KNOB_WIDTH * numberFromCenter`

It allows me to specify the knob number and it does the rest. 

This works as expected in HISE Standalone on Win11, b33fa635e639a31bb0d5cc8252ada4e31ab13737 .  I don't

But when compiled to VSTi, it compiles successfully and only on plugin scan/load does it fail. Reaper asks me to terminate the VSTi and blacklists it after 5 seconds. I tested with the consts replaced by magic numbers (int) and the result is the same.

I have the "Enable global preprocessor" in settings disabled, but I have #on at the beginning of my script.

I'm flagging it as breaking because it works in HISE, compiles successfully and then the VSTi won't load. 

It took me a bit to manually go through every change from a previous commit that worked and nail it down to the preprocessor. Is there a tool for debugging something like this, when the VSTi compiles, works in HISE but simply refuses to load?
